docs.lead_paragraph: To increase enrollment in health insurance, the Houston health department is using emergency management tactics to targeting the uninsured.

byline.contributor: This story was produced in partnership with Kaiser Health News, an editorially independent program of the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation, a nonprofit, nonpartisan health policy research and communication organization not affiliated with Kaiser Permanente.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new ad campaign of distortion is the vanguard of a sophisticated secret-money operation.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that $20 million advertising blitz produced by Americans For Prosperity, conservative advocacy group financed by billionaire industrialists David and Charles Koch, is already taking a serious political toll on Democrats; contends the campaign and the Koch brothers' political advocacy network make a good case for increasing transparency in political advertising.
docs.snippet: A new ad campaign of distortion is the vanguard of a sophisticated secret-money operation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is cracking down on doctors who repeatedly overcharge Medicare patients; the government may even disclose how much individual physicians are paid for treating Medicare patients.

headline.main: Doctors Abusing Medicare Face Fines and Expulsion
headline.print_headline: Doctors Abusing Medicare Face Fines and Expulsion

docs.abstract: Obama administration is cracking down on doctors who repeatedly over-charge Medicare patients; under new directive doctors, termed recalcitrant providers, would face civil fines and could be expelled from Medicare and other federal health programs; government may also for first time disclose how much individual physicians are paid for treating Medicare patients.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration is cracking down on doctors who repeatedly overcharge Medicare patients; the government may even disclose how much individual physicians are paid for treating Medicare patients.

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A Vermont woman held against her will for more than five weeks at a psychiatric ward after her estranged husband killed their son and then hanged himself was ordered released by a judge Friday.

headline.main: Vt. Mother Held in Psychiatric Ward Freed by Judge
headline.print_headline: Vt. Mother Held in Psychiatric Ward Freed by Judge

docs.snippet: A Vermont woman held against her will for more than five weeks at a psychiatric ward after her estranged husband killed their son and then hanged himself was ordered released by a judge Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The former Republican presidential candidate is back to talking his way into a controversy. Well, now we know what he’s been up to lately.
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column cites speech by Mike Huckabee at Republican Party gathering denying that party maintains a 'war on women'; holds disjointed and offensive speech reinforces Huckabee's fall since he ran for president, as well as party's continuing alienation of women voters.
docs.snippet: The former Republican presidential candidate is back to talking his way into a controversy. Well, now we know what he’s been up to lately.

docs.lead_paragraph: For nearly a week, two dozen pioneers of sustainable agriculture from the United States and Canada shared decades’ worth of stories, secrets and anxieties.
docs.abstract: Two dozen organic farmers from United States and Canada share decades worth of stories, secrets and anxieties at week-long conference at Esalen Institute in Big Sur, Calif.
docs.snippet: For nearly a week, two dozen pioneers of sustainable agriculture from the United States and Canada shared decades’ worth of stories, secrets and anxieties.

docs.lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner hopes to use a three-day party retreat to pave a legislative path to the midterm elections.

headline.main: House G.O.P. Leaders Aim to Bridge Party’s Divisions to Avoid Debt Limit Face-Off
headline.print_headline: House G.O.P. Leaders Aim to Bridge Party’s Divisions to Avoid Debt Limit Face-Off

docs.abstract: House Speaker John A Boehner will seek to emerge from three-day House Republican retreat with a diminished opposition inside his party to avoid a showdown in the 11 legislative days that remain before the federal government exhausts its borrowing authority; they are still divided over how to raise the federal debt limit and other critical issues.
docs.snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner hopes to use a three-day party retreat to pave a legislative path to the midterm elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court granted an injunction sought by an order of Roman Catholic nuns who object to the requirement to cover contraception.

headline.main: In Nuns’ Suit, Justices Block Key Mandate in Health Law
headline.print_headline: In Nuns’ Suit, Justices Block Key Mandate in Health Law

docs.abstract: Supreme Court extends temporary order from Justice Sonia Sotomayor barring the Obama administration from enforcing the contraception coverage requirement of the Affordable Care Act against an order of Roman Catholic nuns; federal rules issued under the health law require most employers to provide insurance coverage for contraception; nuns say requirement is offensive to their religious beliefs.
docs.snippet: The Supreme Court granted an injunction sought by an order of Roman Catholic nuns who object to the requirement to cover contraception.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Nunn, the daughter of a former senator, is running for the Senate in a campaign that is testing whether the state’s shifting demographics can send a Democrat to Washington.

headline.main: Old Democratic Name (Nunn) Stakes Bid on Shifting Georgia
headline.print_headline: Old Democratic Name (Nunn) Stakes Bid on Shifting Georgia

docs.abstract: Michelle Nunn, daughter of former Sen Sam Nunn, has undertaken Senate campaign in Georgia that will test whether state's shifting demographics can send a Democrat to Washington; Nunn hopes to capitalize on her family name and the growing power of black and Latino voters.
docs.snippet: Michelle Nunn, the daughter of a former senator, is running for the Senate in a campaign that is testing whether the state’s shifting demographics can send a Democrat to Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Friday offered a short-term compromise that would continue to exempt a group of Denver nuns that operates charity nursing homes from the birth control mandate of the nation's health care law if they declare their objections in writing.

headline.main: Court Gives Nuns a Compromise on Health Care Issue
headline.print_headline: Court Gives Nuns a Compromise on Health Care Issue
